column4: what is main difference between Lubuntu 12.04 and Ubuntu 12.04 with LXDE regarding performance?
so if I install LXDE on 12.04 ubuntu I can keep Nautilus and 5 year LTS?
lubuntu (which is LXDE) is not an LTS release.
thanks for clarification,Ill wait to see how will  Mint 13 perform on my old pc. If everything fails ill try Xubuntu. I think it has 5 yr LTS
Geez us with old PC dont have any luck with LTS
that's not what it's there for
so ill get securtiy updaes for ubuntu but wont get updates for LXDE and XFCE?
you'll get security updates to the core OS components on any LTS release.
but the external components such as xfce (for example) are down to the team that maintains it
Well then Lubuntu can get security updates for 5 next years? It just wont get any LXDE updates after 18 months right?
at a basic level, sure, that's it
Thanks ikonia If I do remember correctly you helped me in past with ubuntu 10.10. Keep up the good work. Bye
